body.p:
Head Quarters 40th Reft. Ky Militia
Hickman Ky January 12. 1864.
General D. W. Lindsey
Inspector General of Kentucky.
General.

Immediately upon the receipt of the return of the Election for Major of the 2d Bat. of my Regiment for correction, upon its recommitment from your office. I conceived it to be the proper way, to order another election. This I did at once, as you will perceive from a copy of the Order, and herewith inclosed.

After waiting a whole week, for the returns, none have come to hand; but I am informed, that no election was held. Under the circumstances therefore, I feel justified in suggesting, that an appointment be immediately made by His Excellency, the Governor. If I may be permitted to do so, I respectfully recommend W Francis Buckner Esq, as a gentleman fully competent for the office. A Civil Engineer by profession, an original, consistent and devoted friend of the Union, he is one of the few men, who in the darkest day of rebel tyranny in this region, maintained the integrity of his position, and preserved his faith unshaken

With great respect
I have the honor to be
Your Obt Servt
G. C Hallet
Col. Comdg
40th Regt Ky Militia.

40
Fulton Co
Ky. State Mil
Col Hallett
Enclosing Election return
Jan. 12. 1864
Recd I. G. O. Jan 20 1864
